propositions.text: The story begins in Zhili, near Lianjiabao.
Wu Zhen has recovered from his injuries.
Liancheng is excited to return to Lianjiabao.
They decide to buy gifts for the villagers.
Lian Xing, Da Kui, and Wu Zhen discuss the gift buying.
They decide to go to the market in a nearby town.
The carriage turns towards a small town.
The town is small with scattered houses and a main street.
Lian Xing and Da Kui wait at the town entrance with their camels.
Da Kui asks Lian Xing about his whereabouts after parting ways.
A scream is heard from the town, followed by chaos.
The scream sounds like the carriage driver.
People shout that someone is being killed.
Lian Xing and Da Kui rush into the town.
They find Wu Zhen surrounded by ten black-clothed men.
A dead body, presumably the driver, lies on the ground.
Wu Zhen is defending himself with a saber.
The attackers do not seem to be trying to kill Wu Zhen, but rather to intercept him.
As Lian Xing and Da Kui approach, the black-clothed men disperse.
Wu Zhen tells Lian Xing to save his mother.
Lian Xing sees the carriage speeding away towards the end of the town.
A woman's scream comes from the carriage.
Lian Xing pursues the carriage on his camel.
The horse is startled and veers off into the farmland.
A farmer suddenly appears and grabs the carriage shaft, stopping the runaway horse.
Lian Xing reaches the carriage and finds Liancheng inside, terrified.
The farmer warns them that there is danger in the carriage.
Lian Xing smells sulfur.
Lian Xing takes Liancheng and runs away from the carriage.
The carriage explodes violently.
The horse is killed by the explosion.
Wu Zhen arrives and checks on Liancheng.
Da Kui points out the farmer's crucial role in saving them.
Wu Zhen looks at the farmer, who smiles back.
The farmer is about fifty years old, with a strong build and features that suggest he might be more than a farmer.
Wu Zhen finds the farmer familiar but cannot place him.
Lian Xing stops the farmer from leaving and thanks him.
Lian Xing questions the farmer about his knowledge of the explosion.
Lian Xing suspects the farmer knew about the explosives.
The farmer, surprised, asks if Lian Xing knows Wu Zhen.
He addresses Wu Zhen by name, revealing he knows him.
The farmer then asks if Wu Zhen knows Guo Tianbao.
Wu Zhen confirms he knows Guo Tianbao, his master.
The farmer reveals Guo Tianbao is his senior brother.
Wu Zhen asks if the farmer's surname is Yue or Jing.
The farmer reveals his name is Yue Tiannan.
He shows a unique Mojin sect amulet.
Wu Zhen respectfully bows to Yue Tiannan, addressing him as Uncle-Master.
Yue Tiannan explains he smelled sulfur and deduced the carriage might have explosives.
He identified the explosives as "pili zi" from the Jiangnan Pilidang.
Wu Zhen is relieved that Liancheng was not harmed.
Lian Xing remains suspicious of Yue Tiannan's timely appearance.
He suspects a setup, possibly a trap.
Lian Xing contemplates using this situation to infiltrate the Mojin sect to steal the "Xunlong Jue".
Lian Xing apologizes to Yue Tiannan for his earlier suspicion.
Wu Zhen expresses his fortune in meeting Yue Tiannan.
Yue Tiannan states he has been in the area for twenty years.
He asks Wu Zhen about his destination.
Wu Zhen explains his desire to return to his hometown in Sichuan but has been pursued by the Banshan sect.
He now wishes to live a secluded life in Lianjiabao with his wife.
Yue Tiannan advises against this, stating Wu Zhen's whereabouts are likely known.
Yue Tiannan suggests Wu Zhen accompany him to the Mojin sect headquarters.
Lian Xing realizes this is an opportunity to go to the Mojin sect.
Yue Tiannan proposes they travel together.
Liancheng agrees to go wherever Wu Zhen goes.
Wu Zhen accepts Yue Tiannan's invitation.
Yue Tiannan leaves to hire a carriage for Liancheng.
Da Kui voices his suspicion to Lian Xing.
Lian Xing agrees they should observe Yue Tiannan's actions.
Yue Tiannan returns with a carriage and three horses.
The carriage driver appears to be skilled in martial arts.
They travel west towards the Mojin sect headquarters in Motiangya, Luliang Mountains.
Upon arrival at Motiangya, they are met by several armed men.
One of the men, Xiao Linzi, recognizes Yue Tiannan as his senior brother.
Yue Tiannan asks about their master.
Xiao Linzi confirms the master is well and that Guo Tianbao is taking care of him.
Yue Tiannan asks Xiao Linzi to take care of his friends.
Yue Tiannan invites Wu Zhen to see his master.
Lian Xing and Da Kui are asked to wait.
Yue Tiannan leads Wu Zhen up Motiangya.
Lian Xing ties up his white camel and asks for it to be looked after.
Lian Xing enters a wooden house with his zombie mastiff.
The mastiff's appearance causes fear among the Mojin disciples.
Lian Xing reassures them about the mastiff.
Lian Xing instructs Da Kui to escape with his mother if anything goes wrong.
Xiao Linzi arrives and invites Lian Xing to Motiangya.
Lian Xing follows Xiao Linzi up the narrow mountain path.
They reach the flat summit and a large circular wooden house.
Xiao Linzi tells Lian Xing to enter alone.
Lian Xing enters the dark wooden house.
A sword attack comes from the left; Lian Xing dodges using his 'Yi Xing Huan Ying Shen Gong'.
The sword pursues him, and Lian Xing cuts it in half with his dagger.
He sees a fifty-year-old man in green robes, Guo Tianbao, holding the broken sword.
Applause comes from afar; Yue Tiannan and Wu Zhen are sitting with an ancient white-haired old man.
Yue Tiannan introduces Lian Xing to the old man as a remarkable individual.
Lian Xing realizes the old man is the Mojin King.
The Mojin King acknowledges Lian Xing.
Yue Tiannan explains that Guo Tianbao wanted to test Lian Xing's martial arts.
Yue Tiannan shows Lian Xing that the broken sword tip was removed, ensuring no harm.
Guo Tianbao praises Lian Xing's martial arts skills.
Yue Tiannan introduces Lian Xing to his master, the Mojin King.
The Mojin King welcomes Lian Xing.
The Mojin King asks if Lian Xing possesses the 'Kuixing Tizou Tu' and the key to the 'Seven Yin Pearls'.
Lian Xing is surprised, realizing the information must have come from the Banshan sect.
Wu Zhen shakes his head, indicating he did not reveal the information.
The Mojin King reveals the information came from the Banshan sect.
Lian Xing confirms he has the items.
Lian Xing gives the 'Kuixing Tizou Tu' and the key to Yue Tiannan.
Guo Tianbao and Yue Tiannan are visibly impressed by the items.
The Mojin King weeps upon seeing the 'Kuixing Tizou Tu'.
He remembers his eldest disciple, Yang Tianding.
Yang Tianding, the 'King of Kings', disappeared after leaving the Mojin sect and is believed to have died.
Wu Zhen knows the truth of Yang Tianding's death and possesses the Mojin sect's treasure, 'Long Dianxue'.
The Mojin King recounts Yang Tianding's departure after an argument and his subsequent disappearance.
The Mojin King attempts to tear the 'Kuixing Tizou Tu', but Guo Tianbao and Yue Tiannan stop him.
Yue Tiannan suggests the map might lead to a treasure and can be used to find the 'Night Emperor's Mausoleum'.
The Mojin King dismisses his disciples, stating he is too old to intervene.
Lian Xing questions why the Mojin disciples don't use the 'Xunlong Jue' to find the mausoleum.
The Mojin King asks Lian Xing to stay behind while Guo Tianbao and Yue Tiannan take Wu Zhen.
The Mojin King asks Lian Xing how he knows about the 'Xunlong Jue', suspecting the Banshan sect.
Lian Xing admits the Banshan sect sent him for the 'Xunlong Jue'.
The Mojin King reveals the 'Xunlong Jue' was lost by his master in the desert while searching for Loulan.
Lian Xing is disheartened, as he promised to find the 'Xunlong Jue'.
The Mojin King suggests the only way to find the 'Xunlong Jue' is to find Loulan and his master's remains.
The Mojin King gives Lian Xing a Mojin amulet for protection.
He mentions that finding the 'Long Dianxue' would be beneficial.
The Mojin King reveals the 'Long Dianxue' was given to Yang Tianding and is now lost.
Lian Xing leaves the Mojin King, who is lost in thought about Yang Tianding.
Lian Xing descends the mountain and is greeted by his zombie mastiff.
He enters the wooden house where Guo Tianbao, Yue Tiannan, Wu Zhen, and Da Kui are examining a map.
Liancheng expresses relief that Lian Xing was not troubled by the Mojin King.
They discuss the Mojin King's appearance.
Lian Xing agrees to accompany them to the desert, asking Wu Zhen to stay with Liancheng.
Wu Zhen feels a sense of reconciliation with Lian Xing.
Lian Xing expresses his commitment to return to his mother after the desert trip.
Lian Xing notices Wu Zhen's reaction when his mother mentions 'your father'.
Wu Zhen nods, understanding Lian Xing's unspoken request to care for Liancheng.
Lian Xing realizes Wu Zhen is not the coward he once thought.
The map is made of silk and depicts a flying wolf on one side.
When the silk is placed in water, the characters 'Loulan' appear.
Guo Tianbao proposes they go to the desert to find Loulan and its treasures.
Yue Tiannan agrees, suggesting they share the spoils.
Wu Zhen is hesitant to leave Liancheng.
Lian Xing reassures his mother and father.
They agree to depart the next day.
The group of five (Lian Xing, Da Kui, Guo Tianbao, Yue Tiannan, and the carriage driver) arrive at the Peacock River after months of travel.

concepts.name: Lianjiabao
concepts.context: The destination of the characters at the beginning of the story.

concepts.name: Wu Zhen
concepts.context: A central character, injured at the start, who recovers and is involved in the main plot.

concepts.name: Liancheng
concepts.context: Wu Zhen's wife, who is rescued from danger and is a constant concern for her family.

concepts.name: Lian Xing
concepts.context: A main protagonist, driven by a promise to the Banshan sect, who is perceptive and plays a key role in uncovering secrets.

concepts.name: Da Kui
concepts.context: Lian Xing's companion, loyal and often expresses his suspicions.

concepts.name: Mojin sect
concepts.context: An ancient sect involved in tomb raiding, with its headquarters at Motiangya.

concepts.name: Yue Tiannan
concepts.context: A senior member of the Mojin sect, who plays a pivotal role in bringing Wu Zhen and Lian Xing into the sect.

concepts.name: Guo Tianbao
concepts.context: Another senior member of the Mojin sect, who is instrumental in the investigation of the Loulan map.

concepts.name: Mojin King
concepts.context: The elderly and wise leader of the Mojin sect, who has a deep connection to his past disciples.

concepts.name: Yang Tianding
concepts.context: The Mojin King's eldest disciple, a legendary figure who disappeared.

concepts.name: Xunlong Jue
concepts.context: A legendary book or technique sought by Lian Xing from the Mojin sect.

concepts.name: Kuixing Tizou Tu
concepts.context: A map or item related to finding treasures, held by Lian Xing.

concepts.name: Seven Yin Pearls
concepts.context: Mysterious pearls associated with a key held by Lian Xing.

concepts.name: Loulan
concepts.context: An ancient lost city in the desert, the subject of a new quest.

concepts.name: Banshan sect
concepts.context: A rival sect pursuing Wu Zhen and the instigator of Lian Xing's mission.

concepts.name: Pili zi
concepts.context: Explosives from Jiangnan Pilidang used in the carriage incident.

concepts.name: Zombie mastiff
concepts.context: A fearsome dog accompanying Lian Xing, which causes fear.

concepts.name: Mojin amulet
concepts.context: An item given to Lian Xing by the Mojin King for protection.

concepts.name: Long Dianxue
concepts.context: A treasure of the Mojin sect, lost by Yang Tianding.

concepts.name: Peacock River
concepts.context: A location reached by the protagonists towards the end of the provided text.

main_topics: The narrative begins with a journey and an attack, leading to the introduction of new characters and factions.
The plot develops with a revelation of identities and a deep dive into the Mojin sect's history and secrets.
A new quest to find the lost city of Loulan is initiated.
hierarchy.structure: The document is structured episodically, following the progression of the characters' journey and their discoveries. Each chapter introduces new plot points and character interactions, building towards the overarching quest.
